title: Code of Conduct
text: interest fostering open welcoming environment, contributors maintainers pledge making participation project community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, disability, ethnicity, gender identity expression, level experience, nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, sexual identity orientation.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes creating positive environment include: Using welcoming inclusive language respectful differing viewpoints experiences Gracefully accepting constructive criticism Focusing best community Showing empathy towards community members Examples unacceptable behavior participants include: use sexualized language imagery unwelcome sexual attention advances Trolling, insulting/derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical electronic address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Code of Conduct
text: Project maintainers responsible clarifying standards acceptable behavior expected take appropriate fair corrective action response instances unacceptable behavior. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, ban temporarily permanently contributor behaviors deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within project spaces public spaces individual representing project community. Examples representing project community include using official project e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event. Representation project may defined clarified project maintainers.

title: Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported contacting project team https://github.com/qbotics/Rpolyhedra. complaints reviewed investigated result response deemed necessary appropriate circumstances. project team obligated maintain confidentiality regard reporter incident. details specific enforcement policies may posted separately. Project maintainers follow enforce Code Conduct good faith may face temporary permanent repercussions determined members project’s leadership.

title: Contributing

One major feature reproducing scraping process. extent, original polyhedra definitions shipped (minimal package version named min-pkg within package, full-db secondary repository accesable switchToFullDB). code documented within R files. title: Rpolyhedra
text: package curation made based poly package found https://netlib.org/polyhedra/ (Original Help message), polyhedra database found http://dmccooey.com/polyhedra/, provide polyhedra databases format. , Rpolyhedra provides following: module scrape polyhedra different sources found features incremental correction issues found found scraping process. database scraped polyhedra. R6 polyhedron representation ‘rgl’ package visualizing capabilities.

title: Rpolyhedra
text: final users, package provides common interface accessing public polyhedra databases, analyze properties, compare visualize RGL. advanced users, package provides simplified set R6 objects scrape compare polyhedra databases.

title: Rpolyhedra
text: original files processed, simple call getAvailablePolyhedra() retrieves list available polyhedra properties status polyhedra database:
code: #show only the first 10 polyhedra. head(getAvailablePolyhedra(), n = 10) ##    source                      scraped.name            symbol vertices faces ## 1  netlib                       tetrahedron {3,3}\t@Y sub 3 @        4     4 ## 31 netlib               square pyramid (j1)      \t@Y sub 4 @        5     5 ## 42 netlib        triangular dipyramid (j12)      \t@Y sub 3 @        5     6 ## 9  netlib                  triangular prism      \t@P sub 3 @        6     5 ## 32 netlib           pentagonal pyramid (j2)      \t@Y sub 5 @        6     6 ## 3  netlib                        octahedron {3,4}\t@S sub 3 @        6     8 ## 37 netlib elongated triangular pyramid (j7)      \t@Y sub 3 @        7     7 ## 74 netlib  augmented triangular prism (j49)      \t@Y sub 4 @        7     8 ## 43 netlib        pentagonal dipyramid (j13)      \t@Y sub 5 @        7    10 ## 2  netlib                              cube {4,3}\t@P sub 4 @        8     6 ##     status ## 1  scraped ## 31 scraped ## 42 scraped ## 9  scraped ## 32 scraped ## 3  scraped ## 37 scraped ## 74 scraped ## 43 scraped ## 2  scraped

title: Rpolyhedra
text: access particular polyhedron can done call getPolyhedron(<<source>>, <<polyhedron.name>>), returns Polyhedron object. example, retrieve cube netlib database, call :

title: Rpolyhedra
text: try package functionality, simple demo can executed shows 5 regular polyhedra.
code: # 1.  Obtain 5 regular solids polyhedra.2.draw <- getAvailablePolyhedra(source = "netlib") polyhedra.2.draw <- polyhedra.2.draw %>%                         filter(scraped.name %in%                             c("tetrahedron", "octahedron", "cube",                                "icosahedron", "dodecahedron"))  # 2. Setup colors and scales n <- nrow(polyhedra.2.draw) polyhedron.colors <- rainbow(n) polyhedron.scale <- 5  # 3. Open and setup RGL window open3d() ## null  ##    1 par3d(FOV = 1) rgl.bg( sphere =FALSE, fogtype = "none", color=c("black")) ## Warning: 'rgl.bg' is deprecated. ## Use 'bg3d' instead. ## See help("Deprecated") rgl.viewpoint(theta = 0, phi=0, zoom=0.8, fov=1) ## Warning: 'rgl.viewpoint' is deprecated. ## Use 'view3d' instead. ## See help("Deprecated") # 4. For each polyhedron, setup rotation, position and render for (i in seq_len(n)) {   # Obtain polyhedron   polyhedron.row <- polyhedra.2.draw[i,]   polyhedron.name <- polyhedron.row$scraped.name   polyhedron <- getPolyhedron(source = polyhedron.row$source, polyhedron.name)    # Setup angles, position into transformationMatrix   current.angle <- i/n * 2 * pi   tm <- rotationMatrix(current.angle, 1, 0, 0)   x.pos <- round(polyhedron.scale * sin(current.angle), 2)   y.pos <- round(polyhedron.scale * cos(current.angle), 2)   tm <- tm %*% translationMatrix(x.pos, y.pos, 0)    # Render   print(paste("Drawing ", polyhedron.name, " rotated ", round(current.angle, 2),               " in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (", x.pos, ",", y.pos, ",0)",               " with color ", polyhedron.colors[i], sep = ""))   shape.rgl <- polyhedron$getRGLModel(transformation.matrix = tm)   shade3d(shape.rgl, color = polyhedron.colors[i]) } ## [1] "Drawing tetrahedron rotated 1.26 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (4.76,1.55,0) with color #FF0000" ## [1] "Drawing octahedron rotated 2.51 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (2.94,-4.05,0) with color #CCFF00" ## [1] "Drawing cube rotated 3.77 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (-2.94,-4.05,0) with color #00FF66" ## [1] "Drawing icosahedron rotated 5.03 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (-4.76,1.55,0) with color #0066FF" ## [1] "Drawing dodecahedron rotated 6.28 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (0,5,0) with color #CC00FF"

title: Polyhedra Database
text: Install R package using following commands R console:

title: Polyhedra Database
code: library(Rpolyhedra) # if want to switch to fullDB in user filespace, it will ask you for downloading the full database to your home directory switchToFullDatabase()

what: A simple example of 5 regular polyhedra
title: Polyhedra Database
code: # 0.  Load libraries library(knitr) library(rgl) # For foarding webgl output to knitr knit_hooks$set(webgl = hook_webgl) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union # 1.  Obtain 5 regular solids polyhedra.2.draw <- getAvailablePolyhedra(source = "netlib") polyhedra.2.draw <- polyhedra.2.draw %>%                         filter(scraped.name %in%                             c("tetrahedron", "octahedron", "cube",                                "icosahedron", "dodecahedron"))  # 2. Setup colors and scales n <- nrow(polyhedra.2.draw) polyhedron.colors <- rainbow(n)  polyhedron.scale <- 5 # For interactive RGL window #```{r, render, webgl=TRUE} # 3. open and setup RGL window open3d() #> glX  #>   1 par3d(FOV = 1) rgl.bg( sphere =FALSE, fogtype = "none", color=c("black")) rgl.viewpoint(theta = 0, phi=0, zoom=0.8, fov=1) # 4. for each polyhedron, setup rotation, position and render for (i in seq_len(n)) {   # Obtain polyhedron   polyhedron.row <- polyhedra.2.draw[i,]   polyhedron.name <- polyhedron.row$scraped.name   polyhedron <- getPolyhedron(source = polyhedron.row$source, polyhedron.name)    # Setup angles, position into transformationMatrix   current.angle <- i/n * 2 * pi   tm <- rotationMatrix(current.angle, 1, 0, 0)   x.pos <- round(polyhedron.scale * sin(current.angle), 2)   y.pos <- round(polyhedron.scale * cos(current.angle), 2)   tm <- tm %*% translationMatrix(x.pos, y.pos, 0)    # Render   print(paste("Drawing ", polyhedron.name, " rotated ", round(current.angle, 2),               " in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (", x.pos, ",", y.pos, ",0)",               " with color ", polyhedron.colors[i], sep = ""))   shape.rgl <- polyhedron$getRGLModel(transformation.matrix = tm)   shade3d(shape.rgl, color = polyhedron.colors[i]) } #> [1] "Drawing tetrahedron rotated 1.26 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (4.76,1.55,0) with color #FF0000" #> [1] "Drawing octahedron rotated 2.51 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (2.94,-4.05,0) with color #CCFF00" #> [1] "Drawing cube rotated 3.77 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (-2.94,-4.05,0) with color #00FF66" #> [1] "Drawing icosahedron rotated 5.03 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (-4.76,1.55,0) with color #0066FF" #> [1] "Drawing dodecahedron rotated 6.28 in (1,0,0) axis. Translated to (0,5,0) with color #CC00FF"  #rgl::rglwidget() #rgl::rgl.snapshot("man/figures/README-5-polyhedra.png")

title: Polyhedra Database
text: Includes 142 polyhedra definitions. PHD format created describe geometric polyhedron definitions derived mathematically Andrew Hume Kaleido program Zvi Har’El. PHD files generated using poly2 library (longer maintained). Although code available, specific programming skills required run . PHD files can found extdata/netlib.org/polyhedra/index.html

title: Polyhedra Database
text: Includes 767 polyhedra definitions. polyhedra database built David Mccooey open format scraped feed Rpolyhedra database dmccooey files can found extdata/dmccooey.com/polyhedra/

title: Get available polyhedra — getAvailablePolyhedra

title: Get available polyhedra — getAvailablePolyhedra
text: sources string vector containing source, can obtained getAvailableSources(). search.string search string

title: Get available polyhedra — getAvailablePolyhedra
code: # gets all polyhedra in the database available.polyhedra <- getAvailablePolyhedra()  # returns all polyhedra from a given source, in this case, netlib available.netlib.polyhedra <- getAvailablePolyhedra(sources = "netlib")  # search within the polyhedron names  cube <- getAvailablePolyhedra(sources = "netlib", search.string = "cube") cube #>    source                     scraped.name            symbol vertices faces #> 2  netlib                             cube {4,3}\t@P sub 4 @        8     6 #> 90 netlib   augmented truncated cube (j66)      \t@Q sub 4 @       28    22 #> 91 netlib biaugmented truncated cube (j67)      \t@Q sub 4 @       32    30 #>     status #> 2  scraped #> 90 scraped #> 91 scraped

title: Get available sources — getAvailableSources
text: Gets list names available sources database used later references package.

title: Get available sources — getAvailableSources
text: sources string vector, can obtained getAvailableSources()

title: Get available sources — getAvailableSources
code: # gets all sources in the database available.sources <- getAvailableSources()  # returns all polyhedra from all sources available.polyhedra <- getAvailablePolyhedra(sources = available.sources)  # search within the polyhedron names from all sources cubes <- getAvailablePolyhedra(   sources = available.sources,   search.string = "cube" ) cubes #>    source                     scraped.name            symbol vertices faces #> 2  netlib                             cube {4,3}\t@P sub 4 @        8     6 #> 90 netlib   augmented truncated cube (j66)      \t@Q sub 4 @       28    22 #> 91 netlib biaugmented truncated cube (j67)      \t@Q sub 4 @       32    30 #>     status #> 2  scraped #> 90 scraped #> 91 scraped

title: Scrape polyhedra objects — scrapePolyhedra
text: Gets polyhedra objects text files different sources, scheduling scraping using predefined configurations.

title: Scrape polyhedra objects — scrapePolyhedra
code: scrapePolyhedra(   scrape.config,   source.filenames = NULL,   sources.config = getUserEnvir(".available.sources"),   logger = lgr )

title: Scrape polyhedra objects — scrapePolyhedra
text: scrape.config predefined configuration scraping source.filenames null specify source filenames scrape sources.config sources used function logger logger inheriting threshold calling class/function

title: Scrape polyhedra sources — scrapePolyhedraSources
text: Scrapes polyhedra objects text files different sources, order make available package.

title: Scrape polyhedra sources — scrapePolyhedraSources
code: scrapePolyhedraSources(sources.config =          getUserEnvir(".available.sources"),     max.quant.config.schedule = 0,     max.quant.scrape = 0, time2scrape.source = 30,     source.filenames = NULL, retry.scrape = FALSE,     logger = lgr)

title: Scrape polyhedra sources — scrapePolyhedraSources
text: sources.config sources used function max.quant.config.schedule number files schedule max.quant.scrape number files scrape time2scrape.source time applied scrape source source.filenames null specify source filenames scrape retry.scrape retry scrape? logger logger inheriting threshold calling class/function

title: Switch to full database — switchToFullDatabase
text: Prompts user changing database fulldb user filespace. Also, allows user switch back package database, minimal one testing purposes.

title: Switch to full database — switchToFullDatabase
text: env environment run , can PACKAGE, logger logger inheriting threshold calling class/function HOME NA. NA, asks user Environment.

title: Rpolyhedra 0.5.4
text: Documentation updated RoxygenNote invalid links updated

title: Rpolyhedra 0.5.3
text: Polyhedrons can generated without normalizing size

title: Rpolyhedra 0.5.0
text: CI moved github actions Updated documentation

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.4
text: Roxygen changed way R6 classes documented Problems testhat tests

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-03-26 First version published using devtools::release() rOpenSci.org.

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.2
text: Calculates normalizes polyhedra size using geometry::convhulln instead bounding box

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.2
text: polyhedron now applies internal transformation matrix

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-02-20 First version published rOpenSci.org.

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.1
text: Complies prerequisites rOpenSci applies suggestions made rOpenSci reviewers. Fixes test writes user space. Integrates codecov.io, allows better test coverage. Updated examples.

title: Rpolyhedra 0.4.0
text: Rpolyhedra can export polyhedra definitions XML.

title: Rpolyhedra 0.3.0
text: Rpolyhedra now new database format based ascii RDSs, meant use less memory, example used Shiny App. Rpolyhedra now uses transformation matrix general polyhedra manipulation.
